trend_summary: Across the series, dispersed villages and farmsteads grow modestly, with new housing clusters and sheds at crossroads. A curved bypass appears in the north-east, and minor roads are widened. Farmland still dominates, though small patches turn to woodland or pasture. Change is gradual; the landscape remains largely rural and low-density.
notable_changes: New curved bypass/highway constructed in the north-east corridor.
Incremental housing infill around the central village enlarges its footprint.
Additional isolated farmsteads emerge along secondary roads.
Several southern cropland parcels transition to woodland or fallow pasture.
